contentrichtext.text: '''Bobby F. (Bob) England''' is a [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] representing the state's one hundred twelfth [[North Carolina House of Representatives|House]] district, including constituents in [[Cleveland County, North Carolina|Cleveland]] and [[Rutherford County, North Carolina|Rutherford]] counties. A [[physician]] and [[United States Air Force]] veteran from [[Ellenboro, North Carolina]], England is currently (2009-2010 session) serving in his fourth term in the state House. In 2009, England was credited with helping to save the life of fellow Rep. [[Becky Carney]], who suffered cardiac arrest at the state legislative building. [http://projects.newsobserver.com/under_the_dome/carney_recovering] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = England, Bobby F. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:England, Bobby F.}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:North Carolina Democrats]] [[Category:Living people]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
